programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: New series. A look at the impact of the arrival of spring around the nation, with John Craven and Keeley Donovan kicking things off by investigating what makes the season's weather so special. Jules Hudson takes to the saddle to find out why this is a crucial time for New Forest ponies and Margherita Taylor reports on how to tap trees for silver birch sap. Every day this week, Paul Martin will be breathing new life into his Victorian smallholding in Wiltshire, starting with the hunt for a perfect breed of sheep to help restore his fields.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin investigate a semi in Ilkeston, Derby and a flat in Streatham Hill, south London. It's all about creating smart kitchens and bathrooms, while the new owners of a bungalow in Somerset's Portishead have to wrestle with an unexpected issue regarding their auction buy.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officers from Avon and Somerset's neighbourhood policing teams get more than they bargained for when they stop a familiar face in Weston-super-Mare, and a shoplifter is taught a lesson. Rav Wilding presents.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Plainclothes police officers tackle the problem of drug dealers conning pub and club-goers in Soho and there is a London Fashion Week photoshoot at a leading department store.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw oversees proceedings in Lincoln as a father-and-daughter team takes on a mother-and-daughter duo, each buying three items in the hope of making the most profit at auction. Experts Kate Bliss and Raj Bisram are on hand to advise.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen and Valerie are roped into working on a Saturday and are surprised to find Daniel at the surgery. Meanwhile, Sid is the victim of a cruel prank and Mrs Tembe comes face to face with a naked truth.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman tours the west of Scotland looking for a suitable property for a pair of animal lovers with a budget of £350,000. Along the way, she tries her hand at the traditional sport of curling, and visits a factory in Ayrshire that uses local granite to manufacture Olympic-standard stones for the sport.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Stockport, Greater Manchester, Sarah Moore sets about transforming an old leather sofa, some angle iron and an antique writing slope. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A selection of interesting and previously unseen finds from the show's travels around the country, with items ranging from an art deco pair of Lalique vases to a 9.5mm projector.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The programme investigates the ruthless world of the dog trade. Using secret filming, reporter Sam Poling tracks the supply chain of dogs around the country, and uncovers some shocking truths about where and how these animals are being bred.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy and Sharon offer to help as Phil struggles to support his mother - but he continues to push everyone away. However, just before the episode is out, another familiar face appears. Meanwhile, Ian is slammed in the local paper for his decision to sell the restaurant, and as if that weren't bad enough he is then confronted by Peggy, who tries to make him see sense. However, it seems the former Queen Vic landlady has a few loose ends to tie up as next on her list is Stacey. Will she have forgiven her for everything that happened with Archie?.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Jo Brand, Roisin Conaty and Paul Foot, and TV wildlife presenter Ray Mears.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring Peter reminiscing about his school holidays. Plus, a chance to see the singles evening at the club from the first series of Phoenix Nights and a look at what happened when Geraldine McQueen met Paul McCartney.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray tells Bex he has decided to leave his job, but is disappointed when he doesn't quite get the positive reaction that he was looking for. He returns to the office where Emma invites him out for a night out with some of their colleagues that evening, but when he arrives at the pub it turns out that it's just him and Emma - they proceed to get quite drunk. Meanwhile, Bex feels bad about her reaction to his news and goes round to his house - only to be told by Grant that he's out with Emma. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Frankie Boyle hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Citizen Khan star Adil Ray one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Oscar-winning star of Hunger Games Jennifer Lawrence and Last King of Scotland and Atonement actor James McAvoy, co-stars of new movie X-Men: Apocalypse. Plus, comedian Jack Whitehall, star of Mother's Day and Hollywood legend Johnny Depp, who is returning as the Mad Hatter in Alice Through the Looking Glass. Will.i.am performs his new single Boys and Girls, alongside singer-songwriter Pia Mia.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts offer advice on collectable toys and games and Elizabeth Talbot learns the art of making teddy bears at a factory in Ironbridge, Shropshire. Presenter Paul Martin discusses snuff boxes with James Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Visits to three more properties, featuring two in Wolverhampton and Greenford, west London, that need a lot of work, and one near Derby that the owners believe needs just minor improvements.(n)

programme.title: Food Detectives
programme.desc: Alice Roberts looks at gluten free food, one of the fastest growing trends in British supermarkets. With the help of 30 volunteers, she tests the claim that some people feel less bloated and more alert when they cut gluten from their diet. Plus, Tom Kerridge reveals how using garnishes, such as basil oil in soup, can transform everyday dishes into something special, and Sean Fletcher explores the rise of online cashback apps that can save a lot of money on the weekly shop.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don pays a visit to the RHS Malvern Spring Festival, where he is joined by Carol Klein and Chelsea gold medal-winner Adam Frost. With over 70 floral displays on show, Monty is on the lookout for scented plants to take back to Longmeadow. Plus, Carol advises on plants to buy for problem places in the garden and Adam takes a tour of the show gardens to find the best take-home design tips.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the second Diamond League event of the season, held at Shanghai Stadium in China.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Pies & Puds
programme.desc: Paul creates a tart made with three types of onion, and a roulade pudding prepared with Britain's most traditional peppermint fragrance. Plus, spiced biryani pies made by chef Manju Malhi.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Linford Christie joins comedy star Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television that helped set him on the path to success as an Olympic sprinter, from the crazy kicks and amazing flicks of 1970s wrestling to the antics of Bob and Terry in The Likely Lads, via the world's first superstar footballer on and off the small screen.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing's Len Goodman takes broadcaster Gyles Brandreth on a journey to Broadstairs in Kent to recreate a family holiday experience from 1955. The pair travel in a vintage VW Beetle, talk about the B&B where the then eight-year-old Gyles stayed and uncover memories of Billy Bunter and Mr Punch.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon follows in the footsteps of travellers who made long, arduous and dangerous journeys to reach Jerusalem, where every year millions of Christians, Jews and Muslims still go to worship. In the Old City, he joins in the ancient ritual of walking along the Via Dolorosa, the route taken by Jesus as He carried the cross to the site of His crucifixion.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces finds from Lanhydrock in Cornwall and Bodnant Garden in north Wales, with the treasures coming under scrutiny including a collection of jewellery made for the Suffragettes, a rare painting rescued from a skip at Sissinghurst, and a group of photographs recording the Queen's first Christmas broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Swimming: European Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents live coverage of the swimming events at the European Aquatics Championships, from the Aquatics Centre at Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park in London. This is the first time the event has been held in Great Britain since 1993, and the competitors will be hoping to use it as preparation for the upcoming Olympics in Rio. Gold medal favourite Adam Peaty will look to lay down a marker in the 100m breaststroke semi-finals, while medals will be decided in four events including the women's 400m individual medley. With analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kate Humble discovers the truth about different breeds of dog, from how much noise they make to how trainable they are. Meanwhile, behaviourist Louise Glazebrook is on hand to help people find the perfect dog for them - including a couple who might be biting off more than they can chew with a giant breed and a single father of three who is unable to say no to his daughter.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: New series. Claudia Winkleman welcomes 10 more hopefuls as the amateur sewing competition returns, with Patrick Grant being joined on the judging team by Esme Young, co-founder of fashion label Swanky Modes and tutor in pattern-cutting at Central Saint Martins art school in London. The first challenge sees the contestants follow a deceptively difficult pattern for a woman's top made up of four pieces, before they have to transform a maternity dress in just 90 mins and fit a skirt to a real model in the final task.(n)

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: Will's controversial new play is about to be presented to Queen Elizabeth, but it goes missing and the finger of suspicion points to his best friend and fellow author KIt Marlowe. The playwright has to scramble desperately to come up with a way to recover his stolen masterpiece, though given its politically sensitive content, is he really wise to want it back? Ben Elton's comedy about William Shakespeare's family life and his professional career, starring David Mitchell as the Bard, with Tim Downie.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Burma's Secret Jungle War with Joe Simpson
programme.desc: The mountaineer's trek through the Burmese jungle faces an unexpected diversion when the first free elections in the country since 1990 trigger unrest, and force Joe to divert his journey to Bhamo, a small town north-east of Myanmar. The hills and ridges where his father fought during the Second World War are within sight, but he is not permitted to go there. Once the chaos settles, Joe and his guide Ed Stafford continue their mission, following a river to the settlements and battlefields where Allied special forces clashed with the Japanese military. He meets villagers who still remember the Chindits, and visits the spot where his father's commanding officer was beheaded by an enemy combatant, and the experience provides him with a deeper respect for what Lt Ian Simpson accomplished.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Insect Worlds
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the influence that insects and their close relatives, the arachnids and crustaceans, have on the planet's many ecosystems. He reveals how the landscape of South America's grasslands has been created almost solely by one team of bugs - grass-cutter ants - while in east Africa, the savannah would quickly become swamped in dung were it not for the activities of a particular beetle. He also contemplates the idea that without one tiny creature, the blue whale could not exist.(n)

programme.title: Madness on Wheels: Rallying's Craziest Years
programme.desc: The evolution of the motorsport in the 1980s, which saw the relaxation of rules and the emergence of the Group B era. Hugely powerful vehicles including the Peugeot 205 T16, Ford RS200, Lancia Delta S4, Audi Quattro S1 and MG Metro 6R4 reached higher speeds than ever before, creating a surge in the sport's popularity - but also posing an enormous risk to spectators. With contributions by former world champions Ari Vatanen, Walter Roehrl and Stig Blomqvist, plus driver Michele Mouton, ex-Lancia team manager Cesare Fiorio and current FIA president Jean Todt.(n)

programme.title: Double Agent: The Eddie Chapman Story
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre revisits the story of wartime double agent Eddie Chapman, the subject matter of his best-selling book Agent Zigzag. He reveals how, during the Second World War, Chapman was able to dupe Nazi Germany so successfully that he was awarded the Iron Cross, the country's most prestigious decoration. Includes footage from an interview the former spy gave three years before his death in 1997.(n)

programme.title: The Dark Ages: An Age of Light
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak follows the journey of Islam, from its emergence in the Near East, across north Africa and into Europe, and investigates the unique artistic style the religion left behind as it travelled. The presenter also looks at the development of the Mosque, early examples of creativity by the first Muslims and their scientific achievements.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of Marie Curie - The Woman Who Lit Up the World
programme.desc: Polish physicist and chemist Marie Curie became a celebrity during her lifetime, attracting media attention for being the first woman to win a Nobel Prize. This docu-drama looks at the woman behind the science, revealing a tenacious mother who had to survive the pain of the loss of husband and collaborator Pierre and the public humiliation of a doomed love affair, but who also discovered two elements and coined the term radioactivity. David Malone narrates, with readings by Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: The adventurous aardvark becomes concerned when business is slow for Mr and Mrs Read, and must find ways to make savings.(n)

programme.title: Sidekick
programme.desc: The students battle XOX in a video-game showdown.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM must fight his own urge to be awesome to stop the world turning into a gigantic intergalactic tourist attraction. With the voices of Alexander Armstrong and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: MOTD Kickabout
programme.desc: A look back at the weekend's football fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: New series. Featuring a spectacular hoverboard world record attempt and the Officially Competitive competitors manoeuvre jelly babies with chopsticks.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Epic @ Everything
programme.desc: Experts reveal how to milk a cow, do a cool street dance move, defy gravity, do the splits and avoid a zombie apocalypse.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Tracy Beaker Returns
programme.desc: Frank discovers that his grandfather has died, and wants to pay his respects by paying for the headstone. Drama, starring Chris Slater.(n)

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: When Lily loses her library books, she invents a fictional classmate to take the blame in the hope of avoiding a telling off from scary librarian Mrs Jones.(n)

programme.title: Roy
programme.desc: After failing to be picked for the school football team, Roy embarks on a new diet and exercise routine that has some startling side-effects.(n)

programme.title: Naomi's Nightmares of Nature
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson explores the frozen forests of Northern Finland, as she experiences the life of a tungsten tough little bird, takes a ride with huskies and comes eye-to-eye with the Great Grey Owl. Plus, her survival skills are tested when she has a sleepover in the snow.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom
programme.sub-title: Absolute Genius Super Tech with Dick & Dom: Superhuman Tech
programme.desc: Dick and Dom use technology to have super powers as they try to become superheroes. Plus, they reveal three geniuses' inventions that allow people to do the impossible, including breathe underwater, have superhuman strength, and have extra limbs.(n)

programme.desc: Brother and sister Caitlin and Jack try to organise a `back to school' themed wedding for their parents, who are both teachers.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The farmer takes Timmy's favourite sheep-dolly, so Shaun rallies the flock to steal it back from Pidsley the farm cat.(n)

programme.title: OOglies
programme.sub-title: OOglies Funsize: The One with the Skateboarding Meringue Talent Show
programme.desc: Stunto Tomato jumps through hoops, and his glamorous celery stick assistant comes to his resuce. Dr Rhu-barb is chased by the Cheese-Grater Daleks, who are trying to 'extermi-grate' him, and the apple dropouts hatch a plan to break free. Plus, the dainty meringue impresses the judges with daring skateboarding trick in the OOglies talent show.(n)

programme.title: Zig and Zag
programme.desc: The alien twin brothers decide to go on holiday to their favourite neighbour's house.(n)

programme.title: Just Kidding

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Thalia is selected to represent the Next Step in the first round of Internationals, which sees dancers from different countries team up. However, Eldon suspects Thalia's new team-mate from Poland is interested in more than just dance.(n)

programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.desc: Clara lies about writing a song, Luke refuses to give John access to the van until he asks Michelle out and Maggie challenges Theo to a busking competition.(n)

programme.title: Lifebabble
programme.desc: The team talks about the best ways to enjoy time online by keeping it safe, sensible and respectful of others. Plus, Chavala advises on balancing time online and offline.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Workplace
programme.desc: Brandon and Greta learn about the art of stand-up comedy, getting tips from QI panellist Alan Davies and CBBC's Johnny and Inel. Alex Riley presents.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Faith's homecoming doesn't quite go to plan; and when Bailey's father finally turns up, it remains to be seen whether there will be a happy reunion. Leanne Dunstan and Kasey McKellar star.(n)

programme.title: Zig and Zag
programme.desc: The alien twin brothers' attempts to clone an ice cream in order to cool themselves down have a chilling effect on the whole of Burb Street.(n)

programme.title: Endangered Species
programme.desc: A dispute over personal space prompts Pickle, Merl and Gull to divide up the stump into different territories that they guard.(n)

programme.title: Dragons: Defenders of Berk
programme.desc: Hiccup and the gang attempt to rescue Stoick - with help from Berk's arch-enemy Alvin.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: When secret information is leaked from HQ all eyes fall on Colonel K! Is it possible he's a traitor or is there something suspicious about him moustache?.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A compilation of songs from the series, including tunes about Alfred the Great, Henry VIII, Cleopatra and William the Conqueror. Guest starring Rowan Atkinson and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Operation Ouch
programme.desc: The doctors find out what to do if someone has a broken leg, and Dr Chris meets someone with a bionic eye. Meanwhile, in Accident & Emergency, a patient has been injured performing handstands, and another has a badly broken arm.(n)

programme.desc: A look at how to score a basketball three-pointer, build the perfect shelter and make parents look cool.(n)

programme.desc: Pui looks at real bears through the telescope, Stuffy-locks gets carried away tasting the other toys' porridge, and Tom Panda has a liking for bamboo.(n)

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: Justin is in a singing mood, so Robert uses a new invention to help his friend pick his favourite song.(n)

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: The lion goes fishing with Crocky, but keeps scaring the fish away when he makes a noise.(n)

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The friends play with a bubble and then Po and Laa-Laa play catch with a ball. In Tummy Tales, two brothers learn to catch a ball and play catch with their dog.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The bunny helps do the shopping at Padget's shop, and cannot resist putting a strawberry lolly in his pocket while Flop is paying. The pair must then decide what to do.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is sewing and makes a snazzy poncho, inspiring the squirrels to make one too. When they hear a very loud sneeze, the group investigates and finds a polar bear with a cold.(n)

programme.title: Boj
programme.desc: Rupa discovers a duckling that has lost its family, and so tries to help it get back to the duck pond island.(n)

programme.title: The Furchester Hotel
programme.desc: The Furchesters need to think hard to stop Cookie Monster from eating guest Mr Crumb when there are no more of the waiter's favourite snacks left in the dining room.(n)

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Peso and the Octonauts help an enormous elephant seal, which then overstays its welcome in the octopod.(n)

programme.title: Mike the Knight
programme.desc: Mike encounters a scary beast and learns that being brave is about facing your fears.(n)

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: Marv's mother believes Sizzles is a naughty dog, so Charlie and Lola set about training the animal.(n)

programme.title: Rastamouse
programme.desc: A movie director arrives in Grove Town and gets the residents to help him make his new film - but Rastamouse is suspicious of his motives.(n)

programme.title: Nelly & Nora
programme.desc: On a frosty day, Nelly and Nora discover their breath is making clouds. Animation about two sisters and their family holidays in a caravan park, on a farm beside the sea.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bloom: Here and There
programme.desc: Mr Bloom takes a trip to Blakesley Hall in Birmingham, where he meets Chloe and Inaya, and takes part in a nature hunt around the gardens.(n)

programme.title: My First
programme.desc: Sisi explores the magical world of storybooks when she makes her first visit to a library.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing finds his old baby shoes, which are much too small for him. He has a hard time giving them up when they fit Charlie, but changes his mind when the baby takes his first steps.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The bunny helps do the shopping at Padget's shop, and cannot resist putting a strawberry lolly in his pocket while Flop is paying. The pair must then decide what to do.(n)

programme.title: Wussywat the Clumsy Cat
programme.desc: Duckadile and Wussywat discover a lost chick and helps him find his mum using a trail of little yellow feathers.(n)

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The fruit tea-loving bird-like characters visit a butterfly farm, where they watch all kinds of butterflies flying around them. Back in the boat the Twirlywoos are tickled by a little starfish which comes out of Peekaboo's house.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.sub-title: Something Special: We're All Friends: Cafe
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a cafe, whilst Mr Tumble and Aunt Polly get ready for the Tumbleton trifle competition.(n)

programme.title: Let's Play
programme.desc: Sid wants to be a ballet dancer, but must buy new shoes and find out whether he is strong enough to lift a prima ballerina.(n)

programme.title: Mister Maker Around the World
programme.desc: The Mini Makers build a snowy scene in the UK, while in Australia, they look for creative inspiration beneath the waves.(n)

programme.title: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have to solve a series of puzzles in order to get themselves out of the amazing Puzzle Land maze.(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.sub-title: Why Owl's Head Turns All the Way Round
programme.desc: The story of why Owl's head can turn all the way round. Children's animation based on a collection of African folk-tales.(n)

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Bobbles the Bear and Leapy Lion discover a beautiful pea-green boat and set sail for a year and a day as the Owl and the Pussycat from Edward Lear's poem.(n)

programme.title: My Pet and Me
programme.desc: Leah lets her lovebirds out of their cage to fly around the room and they land on Ferne's head.(n)

programme.title: Minibeast Adventure with Jess
programme.desc: Zoologist Jess French watches as a butterfly hatches from its chrysalis, and another feeds on an orange with its long tongue.(n)

programme.title: Waybuloo
programme.desc: The Piplings exchange gifts, but De Li is unhappy with what she receives.(n)

programme.title: Melody

Jimmy Doherty meets a man whose job entails harvesting different strains of yeast from locations around the world and Matt Tebbutt looks into how manufacturers flavour crisps.(n)

Nautical action adventure, starring Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Stanley Baker and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Colworth, Bedfordshire: Mystery of the Ice-Cream Villa
programme.desc: The hunt for evidence of a Roman villa has surprising results as Tony Robinson and the team join a group of amateur archaeologists in Colworth, Bedfordshire. Over the years, countless pieces of Roman pottery, coins and building material have been found, but after three days of extreme heat, the expected signs of an ancient structure remain undiscovered.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Lincoln's Inn, London: Called to the Bar
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew look for the remains of a 13th-century palace in Lincoln's Inn, London, a building that became the birthplace of the British legal system and was home to Henry III's Lord Chancellor. They also investigate Lincoln's Inn Fields, the biggest public square in central London. Over the course of three days, both sites produce glimpses of some of the defining events that have shaped the city's history.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Peter and Karen Williams from Shropshire, who fell in love with Portugal's eastern Algarve 12 years ago and now want to relocate there permanently. Jasmine finds them five homes suited to their £150,000 budget, including a property reduced by £50,000, and a house that feels just like their place back in the UK.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton offers advice to Liverpool couple John and Wendy Houghton, who have been married for 43 years and have long dreamt of owning a holiday home around the Spanish coastal town of Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca. The property expert leaves no stone unturned in showing the pair how far their budget of £50,000 will stretch, with the couple viewing a two-bedroom apartment with scenic vistas and a ground-floor apartment located by a picture-perfect square.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Waterlooville, Hampshire, compete to improve their properties in the hope of selling them to buyers Ian and Amanda. Rachel and Matt need to reorganise the downstairs layout of their family home, while Don and Barbie are advised to put less of their domestic life on show to potential purchasers. Also, rabbit owners Mike and Bethan have to decide whether keeping their pets in a bedroom is off-putting to viewers.(n)

programme.desc: The architect meets an engaged couple in Manchester who, after discovering a hidden basement in their new home, decided to postpone their dream honeymoon to Las Vegas and spend £10,000 creating a casino instead. He also visits a woman who built her own shop for £5,000, and in Texas, heads to a tiny home made entirely from salvaged materials, as well as a caravan buried deep underground in case the Apocalypse arrives. Plus, Will demonstrates his creative flair in George's garden build by designing a rotating door.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Commercial architect Martin Walker and his art-director wife Kae want to build the ultimate family home near York, inspired by a giant farm shed. However, her idea for a warm and cosy design conflicts dramatically with his penchant for building large square warehouses, and finding something they both agree on proves extremely challenging on their tight budget. Kevin McCloud follows the couple's progress.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Big Fat Gypsy Weddings
programme.sub-title: My Big Fat Royal Gypsy Wedding
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of an Irish traveller couple's big day, following a team of wedding planners challenged to organise one of the most lavish ceremonies of its kind. The film offers an insight into everything from the enormous dresses to highly decorated cakes as the bride and groom hope their special day will fulfil their every dream.(n)

programme.title: Sex Party Secrets
programme.desc: As the popularity of exclusive arranged orgies rises, this documentary explores the hidden world of the UK's self-proclaimed `sexual elite', providing an insight into the lives of the most selective party planners and their meticulously vetted clients. As the guests sip champagne and fulfil their wildest fantasies behind the doors of multimillion-pound mansions and country estates, the programme explores the motivation behind the desire that drives married couples, young single friends and seasoned sex addicts to seek fleeting intimate experiences and group encounters with strangers.(n)

programme.title: River of No Return

However, the three of them are forced to flee by river on a raft when their farm comes under attack. Western, starring Robert Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe and Rory Calhoun.(n)

programme.title: Posse from Hell

A tough gunslinger who was a friend of the dead lawman takes on the job of bringing them to justice, but the only one of the townspeople willing to help is a naive banker determined to prove his worth. Western, starring Audie Murphy, John Saxon, Vic Morrow and Lee Van Cleef.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Athena
programme.desc: Second World War Allied PoWs incarcerated on a Greek island plan to defy the SS by breaking out of prison and pulling off an art robbery, with the help of their liberal-minded camp commandant. Action adventure, with Roger Moore, David Niven, Telly Savalas, Elliott Gould, Stefanie Powers and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: The Quick Gun

On the way, he runs into his former cronies, who are planning to raid the settlement while most of the men are away on a cattle drive. The prodigal son decides to make amends for his past crimes by defending the settlement. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Merry Anders.(n)

programme.title: Tootsie

When a TV soap advertises a new female role, he disguises himself as a woman for the audition - and wins the part. But the character proves so popular, he is forced to keep up the pretence indefinitely. Comedy, starring Dustin Hoffman, Jessica Lange and Bill Murray. Directed by Sydney Pollack, who makes a cameo appearance as Hoffman's agent.(n)

However, when the woman he loves is murdered by his psychotic brother, Logan returns to his old enemies for help in seeking revenge - and is offered the chance to become indestructible. Superhero adventure prequel, starring Hugh Jackman and Liev Schreiber.(n)

However, the former serviceman's darker impulses remain hard to control, especially when confronted with evidence of the cult leader's dishonesty. Paul Thomas Anderson's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Amy Adams.(n)

programme.desc: Jenny is haunted by her past and hopes that a trip to Blackpool will help her lay her demons to rest, while Carla demands that David tells her what is going on and Sean confides in Todd when Billy snaps at him.(n)

programme.title: Wild Australia with Ray Mears

programme.desc: Jenny tells Johnny about her troubled life on their trip to Blackpool, and Nick and Carla have a heart-to-heart before he receives news from the consultant about his condition. Meanwhile, Billy has a troubling encounter at the Rovers as Liz threatens to call the police.(n)

programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents live coverage of the swimming events at the European Aquatics Championships, from the Aquatics Centre at Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park in London. programme.desc: John Shea presents a concert of music from the 2014 Copenhagen Renaissance Music Festival. 12.31 Schütz: Four Psalms. Daniel Carlsson (countertenor), Karl Nyhlin (theorbo), Leif Meyer (organ), Paul Bentley , Lauf Aruhn-Solén (tenors), William Gaunt (bass), Peter Spissky, Fredrik From (violins), Judith-Marie Blomsterberg (cello), Ars Nova Copenhagen, Conductor Paul Hillier. 12.50 Schütz/Anonymous: Also hat Gott die Welt geliebt; Jauchzet dem Herren, alle Welt.1.00 Uccellini: Bergamasca.1.05 Schütz: An den Wassern zu Babel, SWV37; Aus tiefer Not schrei ich zu dir, SWV235a. 1.14 Schütz: Fili mi, Absalon, SWV269.1.20 Schütz: Die mit Tränen säen, SWV378; Saul, Saul was verfolgst du mich, SWV415. 1.26 Gabrieli: Sonata XIII a 8, from Canzone et Sonate. 1.30 Schütz: Ich danke dem Herrn, SWV34; Ich freu' mich des, das mir geredt ist, SWV26. 1.39 Schütz: Habe deine Lust an dem Herren, SWV311. 1.44 Schütz: Meine Seele erhebt den Herren, SWV494. 1.52 Dvorak: Symphony no 7 in D minor, Op 70. 2.31 Schubert: Piano Sonata in A minor, D845. 3.07 Fruhling: Trio for clarinet, cello & piano, Op 40. 3.34 Liebermann: Suite on six Swiss folk songs. 3.46 Henderson: b1932, Two Love Songs for chorus and piano. 3.52 Debussy: Rondes de Printemps from Images. 4.00 Lithander: Rondo for flute and keyboard, Op 8. 4.07 Pachelbel: Canon and Gigue in D. 4.13 Bach: Prelude and fugue, BWV561 in A minor. 4.22 Gounod: Overture to Mireille. 4.31 Chausson: Chanson Perpetuelle, Op 37. 4.38 De Vocht: Naar Hoger Licht, Towards a Higher Light. 4.46 Handel: Künft'ger Zeiten eitler Kummer, HWV202, arr for oboe, violin and organ. 4.52 Schubert: Gesang der Geistern über den Wassern, Op 167. 5.02 Franck: Prélude, fugue et variation for organ Op 18 in B minor. 5.11 Beethoven: Sonata quasi una fantasia in C sharp minor Op 27`2. 5.27 Wagner: Prelude and Act III Liebestod from Tristan and Isolde. 5.46 Wagner: Wesendonck-Lieder. 6.08 Szymanowski: Violin Concerto No 2, Op 61.(n)

programme.title: Essential Classics"}, (?)
programme.desc: With Rob Cowan. 9.00 My favourite... Hollywood film scores. Rob takes a trip to the cinema as he shares his favourite scores from the golden age of Hollywood. The showreel includes classics such as Max Steiner's soundtrack to Gone with the Wind and Erich Korngold's The Sea Hawk, as well as Bernard Herrmann's iconic shrieking strings accompaniment to Hitchcock's horror movie Psycho. 9.30 Take part in the daily musical challenge - can you remember the television show or film that featured this piece of classical music? 10.00 Rob's guest is astronaut Helen Sharman, who made history when she became the first Briton in space in 1991. Throughout the week Helen will be reflecting on her trip into space 25 years on, talking about life after the mission and sharing a selection of her favourite classical music, including works by Liszt and Haydn, and Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake, which she first saw during astronaut training in Russia. 10.30 Rob places Music in Time as he explores an extraordinary Baroque representation of the elements: Rebel's Les Elemens. 11.00 The artist of the week is British pianist, Clifford Curzon. A pupil of such distinguished figures as Artur Schnabel, Wanda Landowska and Nadia Boulanger, Curzon was praised for his grace and poise at the keyboard. He specialised in music from the Classical and Romantic periods, especially from the Austro-German tradition, and this week, Rob features some of the pianist's most celebrated recordings, including piano sonatas by Brahms and Liszt, piano concertos by Mozart (K.488) and Beethoven (No. 5 'Emperor') and Schubert's ever-popular 'Trout' Quintet. Mozart: Piano Concerto No. 23 in A major K.488. Clifford Curzon (piano), London Symphony Orchestra, conductor Istvan Kertesz.(n)

programme.title: Composer of the Week: Erik Satie"}, (?)
programme.desc: To mark the composer's 150th anniversary, Donald Macleod looks at Erik Satie's legacy and his controversial Dadaist final works, including Relache. Satie reinvented himself throughout his life, changing his clothing, his friends, his beliefs, and his music. Though he claimed not to want to, he influenced countless others, but he had a tendency to dramatically fall out with almost everyone he was close to. Macleod examines Satie's life in reverse, beginning with his significant posthumous influence and working back to the early music which is still a household name. Satie: Sonnerie pour réveiller le bon gros Roi des Singes (lequel ne dort toujours que d'un oeil). Pierre Thibaud (trumpet), Bernard Jeannoutot (trumpet). Satie: Gymnopédie No 1. Jean-Yves Thibaudet (piano). Satie: Vexations. Alan Marks (piano). Satie orch Milhaud: Jack in the Box. Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, conductor Jack Lanchbery. Satie: Cinéma (Entr'acte from Relache). Sandra van Veen, Jeroen van Veen (pianos). Satie: Mercure. Orchestre de Paris, conductor Pierre Dervaux. Satie: Ludions. Eva Lind (soprano), Jean Lemaire (piano). Satie: Seven Monkey Dances from Le Piège de Méduse. Ensemble Erwartung, director Bernard Desgraupes.(n)

programme.title: Radio 3 Lunchtime Concert"}, (?)
programme.desc: The Jerusalem Quartet performs quartets by Beethoven and Bartok from Wigmore Hall, London. Beethoven builds the elaborate first and second movements of his Op 18 No 2, from a simple melodic idea, while Bartok prefaces his String Quartet No 6 with the same melancholy theme and uses it as the basis of the work as introspective finale. Beethoven: String Quartet in G, Op 18, No 2. Bartok: String Quartet, No 6.(n)

programme.title: Afternoon on 3"}, (?)
programme.desc: Penny Gore presents a week of performances and recordings by the BBC Singers and BBC Symphony Orchestra. Today's programme includes part of a Latin American-themed concert the BBC Singers gave at St Paul's Knightsbridge, featuring sacred and secular music from the Baroque and Renaissance eras. Plus, a new recording by Matthias Goerne and the BBC Symphony Orchestra of Mahler songs arranged by Berio. 2.00 BBC Singers Latin America concert presented by Ian Skelly. Padilla: Deus in Adiutorium. Lobo: Versa est in luctum. Correa de Arauxo: XV Tiento de IV tono. Padilla: Lamentations. Ortiz: Recercata prima. Guerrero: Maria Magdalene. Capillas: Alleluia. Dic Nobis, Maria. BBC Singers, St James's Baroque Players, conductor David Hill. (Part 2 tomorrow). 2.50 Mahler arr Berio: Funf fruhe Lieder. Ablösung im Sommer. Zu Straßburg auf der Schanz. Nicht wiedersehen! Um schlimme Kinder artig zu machen. Erinnerung. Matthias Goerne (baritone), BBC SO, conductor Josep Pons. 3.05 Mahler: Symphony no.1 in D major (vers standard). BBC SO, conductor Sakari Oramo. 4.05 Mahler arr Berio: Funf fruhe Lieder. Hans und Grete. Ich ging mit Lust. Frühlingsmorgen. Phantasie. Scheiden und Meiden. Matthias Goerne (baritone) BBC SO, conductor Josep Pons.(n)

programme.title: Radio 3 in Concert"}, (?)
programme.desc: Esa-Pekka Salonen conducts the Philharmonia in an all-Stravinsky programme recorded at the Royal Festival Hall, London, including The Rite of Spring. Stravinsky: Symphonies of Wind Instruments, 1947 revision. Stravinsky: Agon. 8.00 Interval music. 8.20 Stravinsky: The Rite of Spring. Philharmonia Orchestra, conductor Esa-Pekka Salonen. The Philharmonia's Principal Conductor Esa-Pekka Salonen takes the baton in tonight's concert as part of the orchestra's Myths and Rituals series. The concert opens with a work dedicated to the memory of Claude Debussy, who died in 1918, the Symphonies of Wind Instruments, a one-movement work scored for wind and brass ensemble. Stravinsky wrote his ballet Agon for 12 dancers, with choreography by George Balanchine and tonight's performance includes choreography by Karole Armitage. After the interval, the concert concludes with another ballet score - The Rite of Spring, written for the 1913 Paris season of Sergei Diaghilev's Ballets Russes company, with choreography by Vaslav Nijinsky. The first performance of the ballet famously caused a near-riot in the audience, but is now regarded as one of the most influential and most recorded and popular works of the 20th century. Presented by Sara Mohr-Pietsch.(n)

programme.title: Music Matters"}, (?)
programme.desc: Tom Service reappraises the life and career of Erik Satie on the 150th anniversary of his birth. He visits some of the composer's favourite haunts in Paris and endeavours to find the truth behind the colourful stories of his eccentric life. With expert opinion from Caroline Potter and Pascal Roge.(n)

programme.title: The Essay"}, (?)
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Michael Goldfarb drove a taxi in New York during the 1970s while he pursued an acting career. In five essays, he looks back to a time when now-influential cultural figures moonlighted as cabbies, when the Big Apple was a place of violence, arson and near economic collapse - but also of artistic ferment. He also remembers the celebrities he picked up in the back of his cab, today recalling his encounter with the most famous theatre director of the time.(n)

programme.title: Crossing Continents"}, (?)
programme.desc: David Edmonds travels to the American midwestern city of St Louis for the US chess championships. The city has become a world centre for the game, a status it has partly achieved thanks to funding from a controversial multi-millionaire, whose childhood included time in an orphanage. Rex Sinquefield is well known for his fascination with the game and his enthusiasm is shared by many others. There is a thriving chess centre, elite tournaments which attract leading players, a Chess Hall of Fame and lessons in schools. St Louis is one of America's most violent cities and has most recently been in the news for race riots that erupted when an unarmed black man was shot by police. Can the game of chess serve to lessen racial tension and unite its citizens across the board?.(n)

programme.title: Crossing Continents"}, (?)
programme.desc: David Edmonds travels to the American midwestern city of St Louis for the US chess championships. The city has become a world centre for the game, a status it has partly achieved thanks to funding from a controversial multi-millionaire, whose childhood included time in an orphanage. Rex Sinquefield is well known for his fascination with the game and his enthusiasm is shared by many others. There is a thriving chess centre, elite tournaments which attract leading players, a Chess Hall of Fame and lessons in schools. St Louis is one of America's most violent cities and has most recently been in the news for race riots that erupted when an unarmed black man was shot by police. Can the game of chess serve to lessen racial tension and unite its citizens across the board?.(n)
